I personally always try to support Outlook.  obviously it depends on your own recipients but I find more often than not outlook is popular. Regardless however email analytics on all platforms are slightly skewed, because some email clients cache the images, such as Gmail.

<https://help.litmus.com/article/166-how-are-gmail-opens-reported-within-email-analytics>

Yes, it's not 100% perfect, but I have seen platforms report browsers as email clients, which isn't helpful. HubSpot lists "Chrome" as an email client in our email analytics, but we don't have a web version link so I have no idea what that really means. Is it Yahoo in Chrome? Gmail? AOL? etc.

Out of interest are there any mobile friendly issues you've seen with the drag and drop email editor? We've spent quite a lot of time optimising the code output from the drag and drop email editor so that it's highly responsive on mobiles, and cross-client compatible so we'd love to patch up any issues you've seen there to make it more resilient. The "classic" email editor defimnitely has issues, which is why we're stepping away from it over time, but the DnD editor should be _fairly_ bullet proof
